title: (x) Repco logo - custom (similar to Compacta) {Yves (Lex)}
content:
My brother is a mechanic and we are throwing him a suprise birthday. Because of this we are using the logo of the local parts shop ’Repco’ and replacing it with his name as part of a the them for his his birthday. Would anyone know what font this is?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/welcome_to_repco.gif)

 [‹ (x) "Furniture" simple sans - Gotham {Tiff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19484 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Charlie and the Chocolate Factory movie logo - custom drawn {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139/http:/www.typophile.com/node/19331 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Rani

comments.content:
Was this the Repco that you are looking for?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/repco_logo.gif)

Hope this helps.

-nic
Ahh yeah that is it, I do not think my html coding is really up to scratch as I have been trying to get the image to show for the last 20mins. So thank you for that. It is much appreciated.

<cite>I do not think my html coding is really up to scratch </cite>

Below the box you type your entry in, is the secret html decoder link for “insert image”
Thanks for that. fontplayer, I just tried it out an it works!
Unfortunately this logo looks custom drawn, so I don’t know if you’ll be able to do the name-swap easily.

I would start with [Compacta](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.100315.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Repco&sampleSize=48), oblique it, and add some little triangles as serifs. This would probably get you close enough for birthday joke purposes.

- Lex

Compressor Wedge Serif from T26 is also close.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/compressor/wedge-serif/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/compressor/wedge-serif/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/compressor/wedge-serif/")

You could then take back the graphic from Auto Zone and flip the X-axis.

[http://autozone.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071225133139/http:/autozone.com/ "http://autozone.com/")
